activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffery J Napodano

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on January 5, 2023 at 08:30 am.
No acts or threats of violence to any party named in the probable cause portion of the criminal complaint.

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

11:28 AM Defendant Jeffery J Napodano appeared by phone.  Attorney David Kennedy Anderson appeared by video for Jeffery J Napodano.  Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Kim Rau appeared by video for victim witness office. Victim A.M.N. appeared by video. Parties stipulate to identification of defendant appearing by phone only. Deputy Kyle Kunkel of the Rock County Sheriff's Office sworn testimony taken by video. State moves for bind over, defense objects with argument. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Parties argue bond conditions. Waiver of no contact provision was previously filed per Kim Rau. Court modifies bond condition to No acts or threats of violence to any party named in the probable cause portion of the criminal complaint. Defendant to sign bond at the courthouse by September 23, 2022. Defendant's attorney stands mute, not guilty plea entered by Court, jury trial to be set. Bond to continue.
Preliminary hearing on September 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Waiver of no contact provision of bond - AMN

1:36 PM Defendant Jeffery J Napodano appeared by phone.  Attorney David Kennedy Anderson appeared by video for Jeffery J Napodano.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing requested by zoom and within time limits. Court denies motion to modify bond.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 692084,
Payable Number: 272732,
Receipt Number: 22R 026395,
Amount: $20.00
Adjourned initial appearance on August 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

03:04 PM  Prosecuting attorney David S Olson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeffery J Napodano appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Taylor E Klokow appeared by video for Jeffery J Napodano.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. $1000.00 signature bond with conditions.  Adjourned initial appearance August 24, 2022 at 1pm.
No contact directly or indirectly with victim A.M.N. or her children, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No acts or threats of violence
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report
